title: Editorial: Why Climate Action Can't Wait Another Election Cycle
introText: With 2025 confirmed as the hottest year on record, the window for meaningful climate action is closing rapidly. Political leaders must act now, regardless of electoral calculations, to preserve a livable planet for future generations.

content.content: Every major scientific body agrees: climate change is accelerating, human-caused, and catastrophic in its potential impacts. The 1.5Â°C threshold is within sight, with 2Â°C becoming increasingly likely without dramatic action.

Too many politicians prioritize short-term electoral concerns over long-term planetary survival. This must change. Leaders who delay action should be held accountable by voters who understand the stakes.
